core.menu: Open menu to access navigation options

canisters.cycles: are the unit of payment for operating your smart contracts.
canisters.top_up_info: Your current mission control balance is {0} ICP, and network fees for topping up are {1} ICP.
canisters.top_up_mission_control_done: Your mission control center has been topped-up.

sign_in.title: Launch your first satellite
sign_in.overview_1: A satellite is your Web3 app's all-in-one container.
sign_in.overview_2: It provides secure anonymous authentication, datastore, file storage, hosting, and custom domain capabilities.
sign_in.overview_3: 100% on blockchain with low carbon footprint.

satellites.title: Satellites
satellites.description: A satellite is a Web3 container that provides a simple database, file storage, hosting, and permission management system. Develop and run your app on the web, completely on the blockchain with a low carbon footprint.
satellites.name: Name
satellites.enter_name: Enter a name for your satellite
satellites.edit_name: Edit the name of your satellite
satellites.create_satellite_price: Starting a new satellite requires {0} ICP. Your current mission control balance is {1} ICP and you have {2} credits remaining.

mission_control.title: Mission Control
mission_control.transfer_icp_info: Find more information about transferring ICP to your mission control in the

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.short_description: Ensure maximum security and privacy by using passwordless authentication to securely and anonymously identify users.

datastore.title: Datastore
datastore.short_description: A simple and convenient programming model for storing data on the blockchain.

storage.title: Storage
storage.short_description: Easily store and serve user-generated content, such as files, photos, and videos, on Web3.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.short_description: Maintain your brand identity with a custom domain for your decentralized application.
hosting.success: Your custom domain has been configured.
hosting.add_records: Add records below to your DNS provider to configure and verify you own {0}. Do not delete any records as long as you use the domain.
hosting.dns_notes: You might have to adjust above records for your domain provider. Find more information in the documentation.
hosting.before_continuing: Before continuing, the records must be removed from your DNS provider.
hosting.description: Enter the exact domain name you want people to see when they visit your satellite. It can be a domain (yourdomain.com) or a subdomain (app.yourdomain.com).

cli.title: Juno CLI Authentication
cli.sign_in: Sign in to set up your terminal for interacting with your mission control and/or satellite(s).
cli.add: For which mission control and/or satellite(s) would you like to authenticate the new controller {0}?
cli.profile: You can also provide an optional name to easily identify the controller.
cli.profile_placeholder: An optional hint about the controller

errors.no_mission_control: Mission control center is not initialized.
errors.cli_missing_params: Missing URL parameters. Either the redirection URL or principal is not provided.
errors.cli_missing_selection: No mission control or satellite(s) selected.
errors.cli_unexpected_error: Unexpected error(s) while adding your controller.
errors.satellite_name_missing: A name for the satellite must be provided.
errors.satellite_unexpected_error: Unexpected error(s) while creating the satellite.
errors.satellite_no_found: Satellite not found. Return to start to find your satellites.
errors.satellite_name_update: Unexpected error(s) while trying to rename your satellite.
errors.ledger_balance_credits: Unexpected error(s) while getting your mission control balance and credits.
errors.hosting_missing_domain_name: A domain name must be provided.
errors.hosting_missing_dns_configuration: A domain name configuration must be provided.
errors.hosting_configuration_issues: Error while configuring the custom domain for the satellite.
errors.hosting_loading_errors: Error while loading the custom domains of the satellite.
errors.hosting_delete_custom_domain: Error while deleting the custom domain.
errors.controllers_delete: Unexpected error(s) while deleting the controller.
errors.observatory_get_unexpected_error: Unexpected error(s) while loading the observatory data.
errors.observatory_set_unexpected_error: Unexpected error(s) while setting the observatory data.

admin.mission_control_new_version: A new version of your mission control is available! Upgrade it with the CLI.
admin.satellite_new_version: A new version of your satellite is available! Upgrade it with the CLI.

controllers.title: Controllers
controllers.no_delete: Juno cannot operate without your current signed-in identity and your mission control set as controllers. These settings cannot be edited through the console.
controllers.more_delete: However, you can edit or delete additional controllers that you may have added for non-interactive environments.
controllers.add_intro: Grant administrative or read-write permissions to a controller.
controllers.controller_generated_text: A controller has been generated. Please find below the details.

collections.title: Collections
collections.none: No collection is defined. You can start a new one in the tab

users.empty: No registered users at the moment.

observatory.title: Observatory
observatory.email_notifications_placeholder: Enter an email to receive notifications
observatory.cycles_threshold_placeholder: A threshold to limit the notifications

examples.tutorial_1_title: Build A Web3 App With React JS
examples.tutorial_1_description: How to develop a decentralized application on blockchain with React and Juno.
examples.tutorial_2_title: Develop An Angular App On Blockchain
examples.tutorial_2_description: How to create a Web3 decentralized application using Angular and Juno.
examples.tutorial_3_title: Build a Web3 App with VueJS
examples.tutorial_3_description: Unleashing Vue and Juno for Web3 decentralized applications.
examples.tutorial_4_description: How can you deploy your satellite in a continuous environment?
examples.example_1_description: A sample app that uses Juno datastore and authentication.
examples.example_2_description: An example application that uses Juno datastore, storage and authentication.
examples.example_3_description: A demonstration dapp in vanilla Javascript that showcases authentication, datastore and storage usage.
examples.example_4_description: A simple script that performs a get.
examples.example_5_description: An admin script to set documents in the datastore.
examples.example_6_description: A sample dapp that uses Juno datastore, storage and authentication.
examples.example_7_description: Another iteration of the dapp developed with Vue.
examples.example_8_description: Same as the React sample dapp but, built with Next.

resources.resources_description: View a collection of sample code, applications, and microservices build with Juno
resources.changelog_description: See the last updates and improvements.

on_boarding.what: What would you like to do next?
on_boarding.dapp: Develop your dapp with dynamic data (authentication, database, file storage, etc.)
on_boarding.install: Install the SDK and initialize Juno
on_boarding.npm: If you're already using npm, you can run the following command to install the latest SDK in your project:
on_boarding.init: Then, initialize Juno with your satellite ID and begin utilizing any rich features.
on_boarding.local: The following steps will guide you through the process of deploying your app from your local machine.
on_boarding.cli: To get started, begin by installing the Juno Command Line Interface (CLI).
on_boarding.login: Once the installation is complete, you can log in to your satellite from the terminal.
on_boarding.run: With the ability to interact with your satellite, you can now deploy it by running the following command from the root folder:
on_boarding.success: The process should proceed smoothly, and upon completion, your project will be hosted on-chain at the address {1} ðŸŽ‰.
